profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded by Paul E. Baran on March 08, 2013

did.head: Overview of the Collection
did.unittitle: Aaron Hand family letters
did.abstract: Letters between various members of the Aaron Hand Family mostly regarding family matters. Writers include Bayard Epenetus Hand, Aaron Hicks Hand and his wife Elizabeth Coit Boswell Hand, Isaac Platt Hand, and Nancy Fanning Boswell, Elizabeth's stepmother. Elizabeth Coit Boswell Hand was originally from Norwich, Conn.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Aaron Hand (1773-1832) of Albany, N.Y. was a lumber merchant. His wife Tamar Platt Hand (1773-1854) was originally from New Milford, Conn. and Kingsbury, N.Y. They had four sons: Bayard Epenetus Hand (1800-1838); Isaac Platt Hand (1803-1849); Lemuel Platt Hand (1809-1850); and Aaron Hicks Hand (1811-1880). Bayard Epenetus Hand moved to Georgia in 1823. He bacame an established lawyer there and served as his father's agent for lumber shipped to Albany. Aaron Hicks Hand was a Presbyterian minister. He married Elizabeth Coit Boswell (1820-1914), the youngest daughter of Captain John Lovett Buswell and Mehitable Coit Buswell of Norwich, Conn. on August 13, 1838. Their eight children were John Bayard Hand (1830-1877); Katherine Margaret Hand (1841-1925); Isaac Platt Hand (1843-1931); George Boswell Hand (1845-1908); Joseph Henry Hand (1847-1905); James Alexander Hand (1851-1923); Annie Kennedy Hand (1852-1889); Elizabeth Coit Hand (1855-1936); and Gertrude Hand (1859-1936).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Letters between various members of the Aaron Hand Family mostly regarding family matters. Writers include Bayard Epenetus Hand, Aaron Hicks Hand and his wife Elizabeth Coit Boswell Hand, Isaac Platt Hand, and Nancy Fanning Boswell, Elizabeth's stepmother. Elizabeth Coit Boswell Hand was originally from Norwich, Conn.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged in two series to correspond with Mary M. Thacher's printed transcriptions: Aaron Hand Family Letters and Aaron Hand Family Norwich Letters. The letters are in folders as arranged by Mary M. Thacher and the order does not correspond exactly to that of the printed transcriptions.

altformavail.head: Alternative Form Available
altformavail.p: Transcripts of the letters completed by Mary M. Thacher are included in the collection but have not been verified for accuracy by the State Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Donated by Mary M. Thacher on December 13, 2010.

unittitle.emph: The Aaron Hand family letters, Volume I

scopecontent.p: Contents: Letters, 1830-1908; Ohio land papers; Two stories by A.H. Hand. From the collection of Van Tuyl Boughton. Transcribed and annotated by Mary M. Thacher.

note.p: A CD containing electronic files for the different parts of this work has been separated from the collection. Contact State Archives staff for assistance.

unittitle.emph: The Aaron Hand family letters, Volume II

scopecontent.p: Contents: The Norwich letters, 1815-1875. From the collection of Van Tuyl Boughton. Transcribed and annotated by Mary M. Thatcher; The Buswell/Boswell family of England, Canterbury & Norwich CT. Compiled by Mary M. Thacher; Genealogy Charts: Boswell, Coit, Hand, Platt, Tracy. Compiled by Mary M. Thacher.

note.p: A CD containing electronic files for the different parts of this work has been separated from the collection. Contact State Archives staff for assistance.
